description: Reorder fts(3) includes per the man page, as fts.h uses sys/types.h. On linux, <sys/types.h> happened to be define before this anyway, but on other POSIX systems this is not the case.

messages.text: Just picking a tiny diff to try out the review process, from start of OpenBSD port

http://codereview.chromium.org/119110/diff/1/2
File base/file_util.h (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/119110/diff/1/2#newcode16
Line 16: #include <sys/types.h>
Our coding style is to always alphabetize headers, so I'm afraid someone will undo this in a cleanup pass.  Can you add a comment above this indicating that they must come before <fts.h>?

On 2009/06/03 21:18:05, Evan Martin wrote:
> http://codereview.chromium.org/119110/diff/1/2
> File base/file_util.h (right):
> 
> http://codereview.chromium.org/119110/diff/1/2#newcode16
> Line 16: #include <sys/types.h>
> Our coding style is to always alphabetize headers, so I'm afraid someone will
> undo this in a cleanup pass.  Can you add a comment above this indicating that
> they must come before <fts.h>?

Done, new snapshot uploaded.

subject: Reorder fts(3) includes per the man page, as fts.h uses sys/types.h....
